alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Union; Wayne (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 06 at 10:33AM EDT until July 06 at 2:45PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of East Central Indiana and Ohio, including the following counties, in East Central Indiana, Fayette IN, Union IN and Wayne. In Ohio, Auglaize, Champaign, Clark, Darke, Delaware, Fairfield, Fayette OH, Franklin OH, Greene, Hardin, Hocking, Licking, Logan, Madison, Mercer, Miami, Montgomery, Pickaway, Preble, Ross, Shelby and Union OH. * WHEN...Until 9 PM EDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Additional rounds of storms today may worsen ongoing high water on saturated soils. Rainfall of 2 to 5 inches across parts of the watch area over the past day have resulted in saturated soils. Additional rainfall may lead to quick and efficient runoff.
info.instruction: People in the watch area should keep an eye on the weather and be prepared for immediate action should heavy rains and flooding occur or a Flash Flood Warning be issued. Avoid low-lying areas and be careful when approaching highway dips and underpasses.
